qas.question: What is one group that Bermuda's black population can link some of their ancestry to?
Residents of what particular area have awareness of this link to Native American heritage?
During what period were there hundreds of Native Americans shipped to Bermuda?
Why was there a large population of Algonquian people in Bermuda?

answers.text: exiled from the southern New England colonies and sold into slavery

qas.question: Who do Native Americans trace most of their ancestry to?
During what period were hundreds of St David's Islanders shipped to Bermuda?
Who was exiled from the New England colonies?
Who was sold into slavery during the King Philip war?

context: Most of <b4_0>Bermuda's black population<b4_0/> trace some of their ancestry to <a0_0>Native Americans<a0_0/>, although awareness of this is largely limited to <a1_0>St David's Islanders<a1_0/> and most who have such ancestry are unaware of it. During the <a2_0><b5_0>colonial period<b5_0/><a2_0/>, hundreds of Native Americans were shipped to Bermuda. The best-known examples were the <b6_0><b7_0>Algonquian peoples<b7_0/><b6_0/> who were <a3_0>exiled from the southern New England colonies and sold into slavery<a3_0/> in the 17th century, notably in the aftermaths of the Pequot and King Philip's wars.
